item.title: Exploring Bitcion
item.description: # Libraries library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.5 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.1.4 ✓ dplyr 1.0.7 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.3 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 2.0.1 ✓ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(lubridate) ## ## Attaching package: 'lubridate' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## date, intersect, setdiff, union library(sqldf) ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(httr) library(jsonlite) ## ## Attaching package: 'jsonlite' ## The following object is masked from 'package:purrr': ## ## flatten library(stringr) library(rvest) ## ## Attaching package: 'rvest' ## The following object is masked from 'package:readr': ## ## guess_encoding library(Quandl) ## Loading required package: xts ## Loading required package: zoo ## ## Attaching package: 'zoo' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## as.

item.title: Face Recognition and Single Value Decomposition (SVD)
item.description: TL;DR I use Single Value Decomposition (SVD) to approximate photos of my own face and check if Apple’s Photos app can still recognize my face at low rank levels. I find that the Photo app can recognize my face at rank 25, a 98% decrease in storage size from the original image. I hypothesize that SVD works particularly well on faces because of facial symmetry. *Code for this project can be found on Github right here.

item.title: World Happiness EDA
item.description: TL;DR According to data from the 2021 World Happiness Report, wealth, social support, and life expectancy all seem to correlate strongly with happiness across countries. Perceptions of corruption appears to correlate negatively with happiness, though outliers exist. Generosity does not seem to correlate with happiness at all, though the proxy for generosity (donating to a charity within the last month) seems ill-adapted to capture the kinds of informal help offered between members of distinct communities that dominate poorer and politically fragile countries.
